statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.headline: VMI 90, Charleston Southern 81
article.story: LEXINGTON, Va. -- Keith Gabriel scored 22 of his 31 points in the second half as Virginia Military Institute defeated Charleston Southern 90-81 Thursday night. Gabriel hit two 3-pointers during a 14-0 run early in the second half when the Keydets (14-14, 8-9 Big South Conference) took a 51-37 lead. The Buccaneers (17-11, 10-7), who beat VMI 114-81 on Dec. 3, closed the gap to 74-70 with 4:14 left, but Stan Okoye's three-point play made it 77-70 with 3:08 to go. VMI led 35-23 with 3:23 left in the first half before Charleston Southern scored 12 of the next 14 points to trail 37-35 at halftime. Okoye finished with 17 points for VMI, which remained in the race for a first-round bye in the conference tournament. Kelvin Martin had 31 points and 11 rebounds for the Buccaneers, who made 3 of 18 3-pointers after making 13 of 22 in the teams' first meeting.
